sen.j: 浄土真宗東本願寺派（じょうどしんしゅうひがしほんがんじは）は、真宗大谷派（末寺数約10000）から独立した三百数十ヶ寺の末寺・崇敬寺院からなる浄土真宗の一派である。

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）、京都の真宗本廟を本山とする真宗大谷派内部において、教義上の解釈や宗派の運営方針等をめぐって保革が対立し、紛争に及んだ（お東騒動）。
sen.e: Within the Shinshu sect Otani school whose head temple was Shinshu-honbyo Mausoleum, there was a confrontation between conservatives and reformists over several issues such as differences in the interpretation of the doctrine and the operating policy, which developed into a strife called Ohigashi-sodo Strife in 1969.

Within the Shinshu sect Otani school whose head temple was Shinshu-honbyo Mausoleum, there was a confrontation between conservatives and reformists over several issues such as differences in the interpretation of doctrine and the direction of the movement, which developed into a theological dispute called Ohigashi-sodo Strife in 1969.

sen.j: 第24世法主・大谷光暢（闡如）は改革派の動きに反対し、1978年（昭和53年）、本願寺の法統を守る為として、真宗大谷派との包括関係を解き、京都の東本願寺の独立を進めることを宣言。
sen.e: Opposing the reformist group, the 24th Hossu Kocho OTANI (also called Sennyo) broke off the comprehensive relationship with Shinshu sect Otani school aiming to protect the tradition of Buddhism, and declared that he would advance the separation of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 光暢の長男で真宗大谷派の法嗣（新門）であった大谷光紹（興如）は、これに呼応し、自身が住職を務めていた真宗大谷派東京別院東京本願寺（浅草門跡）の独立を進め、1981年（昭和56年）6月15日に認証された。
sen.e: In concert with his appeal, Kocho's eldest son Kosho OTANI, the Hoshi (successor of principle, also called Shinmon) of Shinshu sect Otani school, advanced the separation of Tokyo Hongan-ji Temple (also called Asakusa Monzeki Temple), a branch temple of Shinshu sect Otani school in Tokyo, at which he had once worked as a chief priest, with the result that the separation was certified on June 15th, 1981.

sen.j: 一方、改革派は、光暢が進めていた東本願寺の独立を阻止し、宗派の憲法である「真宗大谷派宗憲」の改定を進め、1981年（昭和56年）6月11日に新宗憲を公布・施行。
sen.e: Meanwhile, obstructing the separation plan of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple which was encouraged by Kosho OTANI, the reformist group expedited the revision of "Constitution of Shinshu sect Otani school "and promulgated the new constitution to enforce on June 11th, 1981.

sen.j: これによって、これまで、宗祖親鸞聖人以来の本願寺の法統を伝承する師主（指導者）という位置付けであった「法主」を廃し、権限を有しない宗派統合の象徴という位置付けの「門首」を新たに設け、光暢をスライド就任させた（光暢本人は就任を拒否）。
sen.e: Based on the new constitution, the reformist group abolished the position of "Hossu", which was regarded as the Shishu (leader) who had passed down the tradition of Buddhism belonging to Hongan-ji Temple since its establishment by the founder of the sect, Shinran Shonin, instead it established a new position of "Monshu" (chief priest), which was regarded as a symbol of integration among sects without authority, and promoted Kocho OTANI to the position, however, Kocho rejected the promotion.

sen.j: さらに、宗派と本山は不離一体のものであるという「宗本一体」の理念を掲げ、1987年（昭和62年）12月14日、それまで、宗教法人「真宗大谷派」と包括関係にあった宗教法人「本願寺（東）」を法的に解散し、宗教法人「真宗大谷派」に吸収合併させた。
sen.e: Furthermore, adopting the idea of "宗本一体"(shu-hon ittai, which means the sect and head temple are undivided and united), the reformist group legally dissolved the religious corporation "本願寺"(honganji, which means Higashi Hongan-ji Temple), which had maintained the comprehensive relationship with the religious corporation "真宗大谷派"(shinshu otani ha, which means Shinshu sect Otani school) to have it merged by the religious corporation "真宗大谷派" on December 14th, 1987.
